value.title: Trump suggests postponing Olympics over coronavirus
value.excerpt: President Trump suggested Thursday that the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo should be delayed due to the threat from coronavirus, which a day earlier was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization. Trump's suggestion comes as several U.S.-based sports leagues, including the NBA, MLS, NHL and NCAA are suspending their seasons or canceling ...

value.title: Trump suggests Summer Olympics could be postponed due to coronavirus
value.excerpt: President Trump on Thursday suggested Japan should consider postponing the 2020 Summer Olympics for a year due to the coronavirus rather than conduct the quadrennial competition without spectators.

value.title: Trump suggests one-year delay for Tokyo 2020 Olympics
value.excerpt: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said officials should consider delaying the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games for one year amid the global coronavirus outbreak, saying the event would not be the same without spectators. The United States is one of the biggest participants in the Games, which are scheduled for July.

images.title: Trump suggests one-year delay for Tokyo 2020 Olympics

value.title: Cristiano Ronaldo is in self-quarantine after teammate tests positive for coronavirus
value.excerpt: Will coronavirus stop Tokyo's 2020 Olympics? Soccer superstar Cristiano Ronaldo is in self-quarantine after a Juventus teammate tested positive for the novel coronavirus. Ronaldo was in his hometown of Maderia, Portugal, but will now have to stay there following the team's announcement on Thursday that Daniele Rugani was diagnosed with the virus.

value.excerpt: ATHENS, Greece -- The flame for the Tokyo Olympics was lit Thursday at the birthplace of the ancient Games in a pared-down ceremony because of the coronavirus. value.title: Japan says no change in planning for Olympics amid coronavirus
value.excerpt: Japanese government spokesman Yoshihide Suga said on Thursday that there is no change in planning for the 2020 Olympics, set to start in July, and there is also no need to declare a state of emergency in Japan due to the coronavirus outbreak.

value.title: Coronavirus response shows Japan still 'paralyzed' in crises -Fukushima investigator
value.excerpt: Nine years after Japan’s 2011 earthquake and nuclear disaster, the government’s handling of the coronavirus epidemic shows it remains hamstrung in responding to crises, the head of the commission that investigated the Fukushima accident said.
